properties.prefix:
Person


  • There are specific field-sets for recommended aspects of description. The “type” sub-field is used to fine tune the meaning, the “value” sub-field is used to indicate a key-word or phrase for that aspect, and the “note” sub-field is used for a longer text which amplifies the meaning or indicates a special consideration.

  • If there is no specific field-set for your purpose, use “keyword” for typed descriptive words or phrases and “note” for typed descriptive texts.

properties.description: The name of the person being described. This is the primary label that will be used in the system and is required.
properties.title: Primary Title

properties.description: The name of the person being described. This is the primary label that will be used in the system and is required.
properties.title: Primary Name

properties.description: This can optionally be used to break the name out into its parts.
properties.title: Full Name

properties.description: Use this if there are other names or titles associated with the person. For example, Wladislaus Dragwlya was also know as “Vlad III, Prince of Wallachia” and “Vlad the Impaler”.
properties.title: Alternate Titles

properties.description: The type of Alternate Title such as Nick Name or Abbreviation.
properties.title: Alternate Title Type

properties.description: This is a general description or abstract about what you know or want to say about the person in the context of your research.
properties.title: Summary Description

properties.description: Keywords, subject terms, key phrases classification codes, etc., ideally drawn from a thesaurus, which classifies or describes the person and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Keywords

properties.description: The type of keyword, such as "profession" or "nationality". Leaving type blank would imply general keywords.
properties.title: Keyword Type

properties.description: Formal strings of characters that are used to uniquely identify the person in various systems. This can also be used to create a formal identifier for the person for your project.
properties.title: Identifiers

properties.description: The name of the system or standard for which the identifier was created.
properties.title: Identifier Type

properties.description: Other entities that are related to the person.
properties.title: Relations

properties.description: General notes that provide descriptions for other aspects relevant to your understanding of the person, and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Notes

properties.description: This can be used to register specific dates associated with the person, such as birth and death dates.
properties.title: Time Periods

properties.description: The type of time period such as birth or death.
properties.title: Time Period Type

properties.description: A textual date such as "the 20th Century" or the "Mesozoic Era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A numeric date or range of dates associated with the Person being described.
properties.title: Numeric Dates

properties.description: This section can be used to describe places associated with the person, such as birth and death places, as well as other places where they spent significant parts of their life.
properties.title: Geographic Information

properties.description: The type of place being described such as, birth place, death place or work place.
properties.title: Place Type

properties.description: Name of a geographic location pertaining to the entity being described e.g. Country, Province, Region, etc.
properties.title: Location Information

properties.description: This is used to identify the time period during which the place is relevant to the person.
properties.title: Place Time Period

properties.description: A textual date pertaining to the place being described such as "the 20th Century" or the "Mesozoic Era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: Numeric dates associated with the place being described.
properties.title: Numeric Dates

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as Begin and End date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the place date being described.
properties.title: Place Date Notes

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the place being described.
properties.title: Place Notes

properties.description: This is used to identify people or organizations that have a special relationship to the person. For example, the parents and siblings, or schools they attended, employers, etc.
properties.title: Related People and Organizations

properties.description: The role of a person related to the person being described, such as “father ” or “sister”.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: The name of the person.
properties.title: Person Name

properties.description: The role of an organization related to the person being described, such as “education” or “employer”.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: The name of the organization.
properties.title: Organization Name

properties.description: This is used to classify and/or describe the physical characteristics of the person.
properties.title: Physical Description

properties.description: The type of characteristic being described.
properties.title: Physical Description Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the physical characteristic.
properties.title: Physical Description

properties.description: This is used to describe the general background of a person, such as religious or other community affiliation.
properties.title: Context

properties.description: The type of context being described such as Cultural, Religious, etc.
properties.title: Context Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the context.
properties.title: Context

properties.description: Either a textual or formal numeric description of such things as the height and weight of the person at different times in their life.
properties.title: Measurements

properties.description: This is for cases where the measurements are just a string of text. For example, “L 12 inches; H 6 inches”.
properties.title: Measurement Text

properties.description: Measurements intended to be a single dimension using a combination of the type, value and units attributes.
properties.title: Numeric Measurements

properties.description: The type of measurement such as height, weight, depth, length, width, circumference or number of components.
properties.title: Measurement Type

properties.description: The value of the measurement.
properties.title: Measurement Value

properties.description: The unit of measurement such as feet, meters, inches or centimeters.
properties.title: Measurement Units

properties.description: The dates pertaining to a measurement
properties.title: Measurement Dates

properties.description: The type of date.
properties.title: Measurement Date Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the last voyage of Sinbad", "20th Century".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A numeric date associated with the measurement being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as Begin or End date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: Explanatory text describing the accuracy of the set of measurements.
properties.title: Measurement Accuracy

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the measurement being described.
properties.title: Measurement Notes
